task.title: Spell checking XML files
task.shortdesc: You can use the spell checker to check for misspelled words in your XML file.

context.p: The following instructions were written for the XML perspective, but they will also work in many other perspectives.
To use the XML editor spell checker, perform the following steps:

step.cmd: Open the file that you want to spell check in the XML editor.
Click Edit Spell Check or click F7.

step.info: If you have no errors, the dialog will contain the message Spell check completed and nothing will be displayed in the Misspelled wordfield. Otherwise, the first misspelling will be displayed in the Misspelled word field.

step.cmd: You have the following options for dealing with the misspelled word:

choices.choice: Click Ignore to ignore the current instance of the word or click Ignore All to ignore all instances of the word in the current document.

Type a new spelling in the Change to field, or select one of the suggested options. Click Change to change the current instance of the word in the current document or click Change All to change all instances of the word in the current document.
Click Add to add the currently selected spelling to your user dictionary. This spelling will now be valid for all XML documents you spell check in the XML editor.

Click Dictionary to edit your user dictionary. All words you have added to your user dictionary using the Add button in the Spell Check dialog will be listed in the Edit Dictionary dialog. To remove a word from your user dictionary, select it and click Delete. To add one, type it and click Add.

step.cmd: Repeat the same process for all potential misspellings identified.
Click Close when the Spell check completed message is displayed in the dialog. This will return you to the active document, so that you can continue editing.

taskbody.postreq: To define dictionary preferences, use the Spell Check page in the Preferences dialog (WindowsPreferences Spell Check).
